"I fear not the man who has practiced 10000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10000 times." - Bruce Lee
This also holds true for LoL game.

Instead of having a great number of champion pools, I recommend you to master at least 1 champion to the point that you can play your mastered champion in any role, even jungler or support without feeding.

There are many other tips, but for now, this one I can give you.

Hope this helps! =)

Your play is pretty inconsistent with a win rate <50%. All of your main champs have kda <2, with  shaco being the only one with a positive win rate. I would say you are placed right where you need to be and need to actually improve your play before you can climb. 

Focus on [dying less](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/tBNPdREA-10-tips-to-reduce-your-death-count), [farming more](http://imgur.com/U0PCCY1) and just [generally getting your game knowledge up to scratch ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iko2tqmDpJQ)before next season. 

It's pretty hard to climb, and I know series can be stressful (I failed my series to plat 6 times) but eventually you will get there if you work hard. Nobody is going to carry you, because it's likely that you wont be able to hold your own in a rank any higher than you are now, negatively impacting games.

Maybe it would be a good idea to seek out people of a similar skill level so you guys can work together and improve together :D

GLHF ♥

**The boards can help you, but no-one will carry/boost you. It's more like we give advice on how to improve.**

The number of potatoes and new players in ranked queue isn't the reason you aren't climbing. Every year hundreds of players make it out of bronze/silver and climb to higher ranks. Some do it alone, others do it as a group. Some get boosted (and then banned). 

You need to approach things differently. You could play flex queue as a 5man until you are confident you have the skills to do well on your own. You could take a break from ranked completely and get your skills up in normals.  

I managed to get from bronze to plat in S6 only by playing support, mainly by playing dynamic queue with people I knew could at least hold their lanes. I also spent a lot of time reviewing resources and my ranked games/stats to see what I could do better (and then act on these). Take a look at the resources I linked and work on getting some mates together for flex (in a less "boost me pls" way).
